name: Longboardlight
tagline: An attempt to create LED-powered light effects under a longboard deck.
body:
## Hardware
* LEDs: a strip of WS2812 or WS2811, 30LEDs/meter
* microcontroller: XMC2GO (ARM Cortex M0)
* power supply: 2,2Ah USB power bank, max. current 1A   
  (not enough, when all 21 LEDs are white at full brightness, Voltage drops to 3.4V but everything is working fine)

## Firmware
* WS2812 driver library from CPLDCPU, <https://github.com/cpldcpu/light_ws2812>
* switching between different modes or color patterns via button

## TODOs
* a more secure USB power bank mounting
* attach an inductive sensor to the truck and insert a piece of metal into one wheel to detect the longboards actual speed
* implement some light animations controlled by the longboards actual speed
* build a boost converter, because 24V is needed for an industrial inductive sensor

## What it looks like
